[F]909.1: [F] 909.1 Scope and purpose. This section applies to mechanical or passive smoke control systems where they are required by other provis ions of this code. The purpose of this section is to establish minimum requirements for the design, ins tallation and acceptance testing of smoke control systems that are intended to provide a tenable environment for the evacuation or relocation of occupants. These provisions are not intended for the preservation of contents, the timely restono spaceration of operations or for assistance in fire suppress ion or overhaul activities. Smoke control systems regulated by this section serve a different purpose than the smoke- and heatno spaceremoval provis ions found in Section 910. Mechanical smoke control systems shall not be considered exhaust systems under Chapter 5 of the International Mechanical Code.
[F]909.2: [F] 909.2 General design requirements. Buildings, strucno spacetures or parts thereof required by this code to have a smoke control sys tem or systems shall have such systems designed * in accordance with the applicable requirements of S ection 909 and the generally accepted and well-established princino spaceples of engineering relevant to the des ign. These documents shall be accompanied by sufficient inforno spacemation and analys is to demonstrate compliance with these provis ions.
[F]909.3: [F] 909.3 Special inspection and test requirements. Engineering and design requirements are included in the chapter for glazing that is subjected to wind and snow loads. Another concern of this chapter is glass and glazing used in areas where it is likely to be impacted by the occupants.
